verses.kjv: Woe to the bloody city! it is all full of lies and robbery; the prey departeth not;
verses.web: Woe to the bloody city! It is all full of lies and robbery. The prey doesn’t depart.
verses.ct: Doom to the city soaked in blood! It's packed with lies and plunder — the violence never stops.

verses.kjv: The noise of a whip, and the noise of the rattling of the wheels, and of the pransing horses, and of the jumping chariots.
verses.web: The noise of the whip, the noise of the rattling of wheels, prancing horses, and bounding chariots,
verses.ct: Listen! The crack of whips, the rumble of wheels, horses charging, chariots bouncing wildly —

verses.kjv: The horseman lifteth up both the bright sword and the glittering spear: and there is a multitude of slain, and a great number of carcases; and there is none end of their corpses; they stumble upon their corpses:
verses.web: the horseman mounting, and the flashing sword, the glittering spear, and a multitude of slain, and a great heap of corpses, and there is no end of the bodies. They stumble on their bodies,
verses.ct: cavalry surging forward, swords flashing, spears gleaming! The dead are everywhere — piles and piles of corpses, bodies without end. People trip over the fallen.

verses.kjv: Because of the multitude of the whoredoms of the wellfavoured harlot, the mistress of witchcrafts, that selleth nations through her whoredoms, and families through her witchcrafts.
verses.web: because of the multitude of the prostitution of the alluring prostitute, the mistress of witchcraft, who sells nations through her prostitution, and families through her witchcraft.
verses.ct: All of this because of the countless seductions of Nineveh, that beautiful prostitute, that master of witchcraft, who enslaved nations with her seductions and trapped whole families with her sorcery.

verses.kjv: Behold, I am against thee, saith the LORD of hosts; and I will discover thy skirts upon thy face, and I will shew the nations thy nakedness, and the kingdoms thy shame.
verses.web: “Behold, I am against you,” says LORD of Armies, “and I will lift your skirts over your face. I will show the nations your nakedness, and the kingdoms your shame.
verses.ct: "I am against you," declares the LORD of Armies. "I will lift your skirts over your face. I will expose your nakedness to the nations and your shame to every kingdom."

verses.kjv: And I will cast abominable filth upon thee, and make thee vile, and will set thee as a gazingstock.
verses.web: I will throw abominable filth on you, and make you vile, and will set you a spectacle.
verses.ct: "I will throw filth on you and treat you with contempt. I will make you a spectacle for all to see."

verses.kjv: And it shall come to pass, that all they that look upon thee shall flee from thee, and say, Nineveh is laid waste: who will bemoan her? whence shall I seek comforters for thee?
verses.web: It will happen that all those who look at you will flee from you, and say, ‘Nineveh is laid waste! Who will mourn for her?’ Where will I seek comforters for you?”
verses.ct: "Everyone who sees you will recoil and say, 'Nineveh is destroyed! Who will mourn for her?' Where would I even find someone to comfort you?"

verses.kjv: Art thou better than populous No, that was situate among the rivers, that had the waters round about it, whose rampart was the sea, and her wall was from the sea?
verses.web: Are you better than No-Amon, who was situated among the rivers, who had the waters around her; whose rampart was the sea, and her wall was of the sea?
verses.ct: Are you any better than Thebes, that great city surrounded by rivers, with water on every side — the Nile as her defense and the waters as her wall?

verses.kjv: Ethiopia and Egypt were her strength, and it was infinite; Put and Lubim were thy helpers.
verses.web: Cush and Egypt were her boundless strength. Put and Libya were her helpers.
verses.ct: Ethiopia and Egypt gave her limitless strength. Put and Libya were her allies.

verses.kjv: Yet was she carried away, she went into captivity: her young children also were dashed in pieces at the top of all the streets: and they cast lots for her honourable men, and all her great men were bound in chains.
verses.web: Yet was she carried away. She went into captivity. Her young children also were dashed in pieces at the head of all the streets, and they cast lots for her honorable men, and all her great men were bound in chains.
verses.ct: Yet even she was dragged away into captivity. Her infants were smashed to pieces at every street corner. Her nobles were divided up by casting lots, and all her leading men were bound in chains.

verses.kjv: Thou also shalt be drunken: thou shalt be hid, thou also shalt seek strength because of the enemy.
verses.web: You also will be drunken. You will be hidden. You also will seek a stronghold because of the enemy.
verses.ct: You too will stagger like a drunk. You too will go into hiding, desperately searching for refuge from the enemy.

verses.kjv: All thy strong holds shall be like fig trees with the firstripe figs: if they be shaken, they shall even fall into the mouth of the eater.
verses.web: All your fortresses will be like fig trees with the first-ripe figs: if they are shaken, they fall into the mouth of the eater.
verses.ct: All your fortresses are like fig trees heavy with ripe fruit — one shake and the figs drop right into the mouth of whoever wants them.

verses.kjv: Behold, thy people in the midst of thee are women: the gates of thy land shall be set wide open unto thine enemies: the fire shall devour thy bars.
verses.web: Behold, your troops among you are women. The gates of your land are set wide open to your enemies. The fire has devoured your bars.
verses.ct: Look at your troops — they're as helpless as untrained civilians! The gates of your land stand wide open to your enemies, and fire has consumed the bars that held them shut.

verses.kjv: Draw thee waters for the siege, fortify thy strong holds: go into clay, and tread the morter, make strong the brickkiln.
verses.web: Draw water for the siege. Strengthen your fortresses. Go into the clay, and tread the mortar. Make the brick kiln strong.
verses.ct: Store up water for the siege! Reinforce your fortresses! Get into the clay pits, stomp the mortar, and fire up the brick kilns!

verses.kjv: There shall the fire devour thee; the sword shall cut thee off, it shall eat thee up like the cankerworm: make thyself many as the cankerworm, make thyself many as the locusts.
verses.web: There the fire will devour you. The sword will cut you off. It will devour you like the grasshopper. Multiply like grasshoppers. Multiply like the locust.
verses.ct: But none of it will matter — fire will consume you there, and the sword will cut you down. It will devour you like a swarm of locusts. Go ahead, multiply like locusts! Swarm like grasshoppers!

verses.kjv: Thou hast multiplied thy merchants above the stars of heaven: the cankerworm spoileth, and fleeth away.
verses.web: You have increased your merchants more than the stars of the skies. The grasshopper strips, and flees away.
verses.ct: You built up your merchants until they outnumbered the stars in the sky — but like locusts that strip a field bare, they'll take what they can and fly away.

verses.kjv: Thy crowned are as the locusts, and thy captains as the great grasshoppers, which camp in the hedges in the cold day, but when the sun ariseth they flee away, and their place is not known where they are.
verses.web: Your guards are like the locusts, and your officials like the swarms of locusts, which settle on the walls on a cold day, but when the sun appears, they flee away, and their place is not known where they are.
verses.ct: Your officials are like locusts, and your commanders like swarms of grasshoppers that settle on the walls when it's cold. But the moment the sun comes out, they vanish — and no one knows where they've gone.

verses.kjv: Thy shepherds slumber, O king of Assyria: thy nobles shall dwell in the dust: thy people is scattered upon the mountains, and no man gathereth them.
verses.web: Your shepherds slumber, king of Assyria. Your nobles lie down. Your people are scattered on the mountains, and there is no one to gather them.
verses.ct: Your leaders are asleep, king of Assyria. Your nobles have laid down in the dust. Your people are scattered across the mountains, and there is no one to gather them back together.

verses.kjv: There is no healing of thy bruise; thy wound is grievous: all that hear the bruit of thee shall clap the hands over thee: for upon whom hath not thy wickedness passed continually?
verses.web: There is no healing your wound, for your injury is fatal. All who hear the report of you clap their hands over you; for who hasn’t felt your endless cruelty?
verses.ct: There is no remedy for your wound — your injury is fatal. Everyone who hears the news about you claps their hands in celebration, because who hasn't suffered under your endless cruelty?
